answers.answer: The International Organization for Migration in Romania (IOM Romania) provides free medical care to Ukrainians and refugees from other countries. This includes free consultations with a family doctor, psychologist, and gynecologist.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Services are provided at RomExpo, which is the center of assistance for refugees from Ukraine. To access a doctor, you must first make an appointment with the IOM representatives located in the RomExpo office.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The services are available Monday through Friday, from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: RomExpo is located at Meresti Boulevard 65-67, Bucharest 011465, phone number: 0212077000. The IOM phone number for Pavilion G-7 is +40 21 â€“ 210.30.50. More information can be found at https://romania.iom.int/.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: To get an appointment with a doctor, you must first make an appointment with the IOM representatives. Their office is located within RomExpo.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/free-medical-care-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the page carefully.
